There is a boat load of geometry going on when trying to figure out what the "drop zones" should be. Depending on where you drop, we'll insert a new sibling column, or we'll "split" an existing column.

When the column is the same height as the module, sometimes the drop zones look exactly the same. But generally if you drop closer to the center of the module (but the laser beam drop zone still shows up to the left or right), it should "split" the column.

_Technically_ even single modules have a row associated with them. But we only ever show a row toolbar if:
• There is more than one column in it
• The row has some sort of styling applied
^^ Those rules were established to cut down on the amount of toolbar clutter the user sees.
Same sort of applies to the sidebar tree, we try to make it less noisy but not showing all the intermediate row structures unless there is a reason to.
